isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL TANDEM AXLE FORWARD REAR DRIVE UNITS - ASSEMBLE - MAIN DIFFERENTIAL CASE AND RING GEAR

svcproc.title: MAIN DIFFERENTIAL CASE AND RING GEAR

caution.para: Never attempt to press a cold ring gear on the flanged half of the differential case. A cold ring gear will damage the case because of the tight fit. Metal particles between the parts will cause gear runout that can exceed Rockwell specifications of 0.008 inch (0.2 mm).

step1.para: Expand the ring gear bore by heating the gear in a tank of water to a temperature of 160 to 180°F (71 to 82°C) for 10 to 15 minutes. DO NOT USE AN OPEN FLAME SUCH AS A TORCH FOR THIS PROCEDURE.

warning.para: Wear safe clothing and gloves that will protect you from serious personal injury when you touch the hot ring gear.

step1.para: Use a lifting tool to safely lift the ring gear from the tank of water.

Immediately install the ring gear on the differential case. If the ring gear does not fit easily on the flange, heat the gear again in a tank of hot water. Rotate the ring gear while still hot to align the fastener holes in the case with the holes in the gear.
On 145 and 160 series axles, install the bolts, washers and nuts that are used to fasten the ring gear to the flange.
Install the bolts from the gear side of the assembly. The heads of the bolts must be against the ring gear ( Figure 88).
Tighten to the specified torque. Refer to the Torque Chart.

figure.caption: Figure 88. Install Bolts From Gear Side

calloutgroup.callout1: 5. BOLT - INSTALL FROM RING GEAR INSIDE

step1.para: On 140 Series axles, install rivets to fasten the ring gear to the case.

note.para: Do not heat rivets before installation. Use only cold rivets to fasten the ring gear correctly on the flange case half.

step1.para: Install the rivets in pairs opposite each other from the flange case half side of the assembly. The rivet heads MUST be against the flange case half ( Figure 89).

figure.caption: Figure 89. Install Rivets in Pairs Opposite Each Other

note.para: The pressure on rivets must be held for approximately one minute so that the rivet body will fill the hole.

step1.para: Press the rivets into position from the ring gear side of the assembly. Use a riveter machine and apply the correct amount of pressure.

para.emph: Press Pressure Needed to Install Rivets

step1.para: After the fasteners are installed, check for gaps between the back surface of the ring gear and the case flange. Use a .003-inch (.08 mm) feeler gauge and check at four points around the assembly ( Figure 90).

If the gauge fits more than one half the distance between the outer diameter of the flange and the pilot diameter of the gear, remove the ring gear. If the gap is less than .003 inch (.08 mm), continue by following Step 9.
Check the flange case half and ring gear for the problem that causes the gap. Repair or replace parts.
After the parts are repaired or replaced, assemble the ring gear on the flange case half. Repeat steps 1-5.
Lubricate the following parts with the same gear lubricant used in the axle housing. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

item.para: Inner Walls of the Differential Case

step1.para: Put a thrust washer and a side gear in the flange half of the differential case ( Figure 91).

figure.caption: Figure 91. Put Thrust Washer and Side Gear in Flange Case Half

step1.para: Install the four pinions and four spherical thrust washers on the spider ( Figure 92).
Install the spider and pinion assembly in the flange half of the case ( Figure 92).

figure.caption: Figure 92. Install Spider and Pinion Assembly in Flange Case Half

step1.para: Install the second side gear and thrust washer over the spider and differential pinions.
Put the plain half of the differential case over the flange half and gears. Rotate the plain half as needed to align the alignment marks ( Figure 93).

figure.caption: Figure 93. Rotate Half to Align Marks

note.para: Rockwell recommends using new Dri-Loc fasteners or applying Rockwell Liquid Adhesive 2297-C-7049 (Loctite #680) or equivalent to the previously cleaned fastener holes in the main differential case.

step1.para: Install four bolts at equal positions in the case halves. Evenly tighten the four bolts to pull the case halves together.
Install the remaining bolts and tighten all the bolts to the specified torque. Refer to the Torque Chart.
